CATEGORY: A. Use of land and biodiveristy

INDICATOR: A1.1 - Population density in built-up areas (neighbourhood area minus green  and blue)
DESCRIPTION:
Population density is the concentration of individuals within a species in a specific geographic locale. Population density data can be used to quantify demographic information and to assess relationships among ecosystems, human health and infrastructure. Intend to evaluate the increase of the proximity
between residents and local goods and services.

INDICATOR: A1.2 - Relation between the usable space of the buildings (volume) and the urban space (area)
DESCRIPTION:
Intend to maximize efficiency in the use of land used for
buildings. Relation between the usable space of the buildings (volume) and the urban space (area).

INDICATOR: A1.3 - Percentage of the perimeter of the area directly adjacent to urbanized areas
DESCRIPTION: Intend to identify voids in the urban fabric and at the same time to contain the peripheral expansion. Percentage ratio between the length of the urban fabric perimeter adjacent to the urbanized areas and the overall length of the perimeter of the area

INDICATOR: A1.4 - Pre-development ecological value of land
DESCRIPTION: determine the proportion of land, considered to be of value for ecological or agricultural purposes, that remains undeveloped. The ratio between the undeveloped area and the total area of the neighborhood.

INDICATOR: A2.1 - Proportion of all vegetated areas within the neighborhood boundaries in relation to the total area
DESCRIPTION: Intend to improve the permeability of the area and to benefit from the availability of green spaces (capturing pollutants, reducing the “ heat island” effect, providing recreational spaces, etc.). The ratio between vegetated areas (in hectares) in the neighborhood and the total area of the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Green areas in relation to the neighborhood population
INDICATOR: A2.2 - Total area of green in the neighborhood divided by neighborhood’s total population
DESCRIPTION: Intend to improve the urban environment helping regulate air quality and climate, recharging groundwater supplies and protecting lakes and streams from polluted runoff. Total green area in the neighborhood by total population.

INDICATOR: A2.3 - Percentage of inhabitants with accessibility to green areas
DESCRIPTION: The goal is to improve living conditions for residents of the neighborhood and mitigate the negative impacts of urbanization. Percentage of inhabitants with accessibility to green areas space of at least 0.5 ha, within 300 meter distance.

INDICATOR: A2.4 - Density of green spaces within the area
DESCRIPTION: Assess the contribution of existing green spaces to the quality of life of inhabitants. The ratio of the total green area to the total area of the neighborhood.

INDICATOR: A2.5 - Share of natural green areas on total green areas
DESCRIPTION: The ratio of the natural green area in hectares to the total area of the neighborhood to improve the benefits from the green zones availability.

INDICATOR: A3.1 - Share of natural areas that are connected
DESCRIPTION: Intend to maximize the connectivity measures for natural areas. The ratio between the total amount of connected natural areas in hectares and the total amount of natural area in the neighborhood.

INDICATOR:
A3.2 - Number of plants on number of
vegetal species
DESCRIPTION: Aim to preserve and maintain biodiversity. The ratio between number of the plants and the number of vegetables species in the neighborhood.

INDICATOR:
B1.1 - Percentage of households with
authorized access to electricity
DESCRIPTION: The goal is to evaluate the electrical services as a contributing indicator of sustainability, resilience and economic productivity. The ratio between the number of people with authorized electrical services to the total population of the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Total final thermal energy consumption for building operations
INDICATOR: B2.1 - Aggregated annual total final thermal energy consumption per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: Intend to estimate urban thermal energy consumption for building operations. Aggregated annual total final thermal energy consumption per aggregated indoor useful floor area. For the evaluation of the actual performance of the urban area it is preferable to use metered data. If metered data aren’t available, estimated data shall be used. Estimated data shall be used for evaluating alternative scenarios in planning and decision-making processes.

CRITERION: Total final thermal energy consumption for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B2.2 - Aggregated annual final thermal energy consumption of residential buildings per aggregated internal useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: The aim is to estimate urban thermal energy consumption per gross area of all residential buildings. It represents the annual total final thermal energy consumption of non-renewable energy for the building operations (Heating, Cooling, Domestic Hot Water and Lighting), in kWh, for each residential buildings in the neighborhood per the aggregated annual total final thermal energy consumption for all residential buildings.

CRITERION: Total final thermal energy consumption for public office/ educational building operations
INDICATOR: B2.3 - Aggregated annual final thermal energy consumption of public office and educational buildings per aggregated internal useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: The purpose is to o estimate the urban thermal energy consumption per gross area for public office/educational building operations. The aggregated annual total final thermal energy consumption per Total gross area of all public office/educational buildings represents the energy used for heating, cooling, domestic hot water, and lighting in non-renewable energy units (kWh) per square meter of total colective area for all public office and educational buildings in the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Total final electrical energy consumption for building operations
INDICATOR: B2.4 - Aggregated annual total final electric energy consumption per aggregated internal useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: To estimate urban electric energy consumption for building operations,the aggregated annual total final electric energy consumption per aggregated internal useful floor area is calculated. For the evaluation of the actual performance of the urban area it is preferable to use metered data. If metered data aren’t available, estimated data shall be used. Estimated data shall be used for evaluating alternative scenarios in planning and decision-making processes. In reporting the indicator’s value, the data source must be indicated.

CRITERION: Total final electrical energy consumption for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B2.5 - Aggregated annual final electrical energy consumption of residential buildings per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: The aim is to determine urban electrical energy consumption per gross area for residential building operations. It is represented by the annual total final electrical energy consumption of non-renewable energy for building operations (Heating, Cooling, Domestic Hot Water and, Lighting), in kWh, for each residential building in the neighborhoood per the aggregated annual total final electrical energy consumption for all residential buildings.

CRITERION: Total final electric energy consumption for public office/ educational building operations
INDICATOR: B2.6 - Aggregated annual final electric energy consumption of public office and educational buildings per aggregated internal useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: The goal is to evaluate urban electrical energy consumption per gross area for public office/educational building operations, which is represented by the annual total final electrical energy consumption of non-renewable energy for building operations (Heating, Cooling, Domestic Hot Water and, Lighting), in kWh, for each public office/educational building in the neighborhoood per the aggregated annual total final electrical energy consumption for all public office/educational buildings.

CRITERION: Total primary energy demand for building operations
INDICATOR: B2.7 - Aggregated annual total primary energy consumption per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: To reduce the need of energy for residential building operations. Aggregated annual total primary energy consumption per aggregated indoor useful floor area.

CRITERION: Total primary energy demand for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B2.8 - Ratio of average total primary energy consumption of residential buildings to the local minimum value
DESCRIPTION: To decrease the need of energy for residential building operations, the ratio of average total primary energy consumption of residential buildings to the local minimum value is calculated.

CRITERION: Total primary energy demand for public office/educational building operations
INDICATOR: B2.9 - Ratio of average total primary energy consumption of public office/educational buildings to the local minimum value
DESCRIPTION: The Ratio of average of total primary energy consumption of public office/educational buildings to the local minimum value. And the aim is to reduce the need of energy for public office/educational building operations.

INDICATOR: B2.10 - Total electricity consumption of public street lighting divided by the total distance of streets where street lights are present
DESCRIPTION: To improve the efficiency of street lighting for cost-effective steps and energy efficiency the the total electricity consumption of public street lighting for cost-effective steps and energy efficiency by the length of streets where streetlights are present in the neighborhood is calculated.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to total final thermal energy consumption for building operations
INDICATOR: B3.1 - Total consumption of final thermal energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final thermal energy consumption
DESCRIPTION: The goal is to incentive the consumption and production of renewable energy. It is measured by the ratio of the total consumption of final thermal energy generated from renewable sources on-site to the total final thermal energy consumption.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to total final thermal energy consumption for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B3.2 - Total consumption of final thermal energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final thermal energy consumption of residential buildings
DESCRIPTION: The aim is to incentive the consumption and production of renewable energy. Total consumption of final thermal energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by the total final thermal energy consumption of residential buildings.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on- site, relative to total final thermal energy consumption for public office/educational building operations
INDICATOR: B3.3 - Total consumption of final thermal energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final thermal energy consumption of public office/educational buildings
DESCRIPTION: To incentive the consumption and production of renewable energy. The ratio of the aggregated annual total final energy consumption to the aggregated annual total final energy consumption without the renewables.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to final electric energy consumption
INDICATOR: B3.4 - Total consumption of final electric energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final electric energy consumption
DESCRIPTION: The purpose is to incentive the consumption and production of renewable energy. The Annual total final electric energy consumption from on-site renewable sources per Annual total final electric energy consumption is calculated to this aim. Heating, cooling, ventilation, auxiliaries, domestic hot water and lighting are considered as the energy consumption.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to total final electric energy consumption for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B3.5 - Total consumption of final electric energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final electric energy consumption of residential buildings
DESCRIPTION: To reduce the need of energy for residential building operations, the ratio of the Aggregated annual total final electric energy consumption to Aggregated annual total final electric energy consumption without the renewables is calculated.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, on final electric energy consumptions for public office/educational building operations
INDICATOR: B3.6 - Total consumption of final electric energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total final electric energy consumption of public office/educational buildings
DESCRIPTION: This criterion assesses the sustainability of public office and educational buildings by measuring the proportion of their electricity consumption that is generated on-site from renewable sources. A higher ratio indicates greater reliance on renewable energy, contributing to reduced greenhouse gas emissions and improved energy efficiency.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to total primary energy consumption for building operations
INDICATOR: B3.7 - Total consumption of primary energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total primary energy consumption
DESCRIPTION: This criterion measures the sustainability of public office and educational buildings by assessing the proportion of their primary energy consumption that is generated on-site from renewable sources. A higher ratio indicates greater reliance on renewable energy, contributing to reduced greenhouse gas emissions and improved energy efficiency.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, relative to total primary energy consumption for residential building operations
INDICATOR: B3.8 - Total consumption of primary energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total primary energy consumption of residential buildings
DESCRIPTION: This criterion assesses the sustainability of residential buildings by measuring the proportion of their primary energy consumption that is generated on-site from renewable sources. The indicator, calculates this ratio by dividing the total primary energy generated from renewable sources on-site by the total primary energy consumption of residential buildings. A higher ratio indicates a greater reliance on renewable energy, which contributes to reduced greenhouse gas emissions and improved energy efficiency.

CRITERION: Share of renewable energy on-site, on total primary energy consumptions for public office/ educational building operations
INDICATOR: B3.9 - Total consumption of primary energy generated from renewable sources on-site divided by total primary energy consumption of public office/educational buildings
DESCRIPTION: This criterion assesses the sustainability of public office and educational buildings by measuring the proportion of their primary energy consumption that is generated on-site from renewable sources. The indicator, calculates this ratio by dividing the total primary energy generated from renewable sources on-site by the total primary energy consumption of these buildings. A higher ratio indicates a greater reliance on renewable energy, which contributes to reduced greenhouse gas emissions and improved energy efficiency.

CRITERION: Availability of a public municipal water supply
INDICATOR: C1.1 - Percentage of the buildings within the neighborhood that are served by a municipal water supply
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that have access to a public municipal water supply. It reflects the basic infrastructure and essential services available to residents, contributing to their overall health and well-being.

INDICATOR: C1.2 - Percentage of buildings within the neighbourhood that are served by wastewater collection
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that are connected to a wastewater collection system. It reflects the level of sanitation and infrastructure in the neighborhood, contributing to public health and environmental cleanliness.

INDICATOR: C2.1 - Total amount of the neighborhood’s water consumption in litres per day divided by the total neighborhood population
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average daily water consumption per person in the neighborhood. It provides an overall assessment of water usage patterns and helps evaluate the adequacy of water resources for the neighborhood's population.

INDICATOR: C2.2 - Volume of water supplied minus the volume of utilized water divided by the total volume of water supplied
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of water supplied to the neighborhood that is not lost due to leakage, wastage, or inefficiencies in distribution. It reflects the efficiency of the water supply system and highlights areas for improvement in water conservation.

CRITERION: Consumption of potable water in residential buildings
INDICATOR: C2.3 - Annual potable water consumption per occupant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average annual potable water consumption per resident in residential buildings. It helps identify areas where water usage can be reduced, leading to more efficient use of water resources.

CRITERION: Consumption of potable water in public offices
INDICATOR: C2.4 - Annual potable water consumption per occupant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average annual potable water consumption per employee in public offices. It helps identify areas where water usage can be reduced, leading to more efficient use of water resources.

CRITERION: Consumption of potable water in educational buildings
INDICATOR: C2.5 - Annual potable water consumption per occupant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average annual potable water consumption per student and staff member in educational buildings. It helps identify areas where water usage can be reduced, leading to more efficient use of water resources.

CRITERION: Re-use of rainwater in residential buildings
INDICATOR: C2.6 - Share of rainwater collected from roofs of residential buildings for reuse
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of rainwater collected from roofs of residential buildings that is reused for various purposes such as irrigation, flushing toilets, or washing. It assesses the implementation of rainwater harvesting practices in the neighborhood and contributes to sustainable water management.

CRITERION: Consumption of potable water in public green spaces
INDICATOR: C2.7 - Potable water used for irrigation purposes in public green spaces
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the amount of potable water used for irrigation of public green spaces, such as parks, gardens, and squares. It helps identify areas where alternative water sources, like rainwater or treated wastewater, can be used to reduce the consumption of potable water.

INDICATOR: C2.8 - Percentage of water acceptable for human consumption or agriculture from solar desalination
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of water produced through solar-powered desalination processes that meets the quality standards for human consumption or agricultural use. It assesses the contribution of solar desalination to addressing water scarcity and reducing reliance on traditional water sources.

INDICATOR: C3.1 - Total volume of wastewater collected for at least secondary treatment in centralized wastewater treatment facilities divided by the total volume of wastewater produced in the neighborhood
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of wastewater in the neighborhood that undergoes at least secondary treatment in centralized wastewater treatment facilities. It assesses the effectiveness of wastewater management systems in reducing the risk of waterborne diseases and protecting public health.

CRITERION: Public wastewater (from outdoor areas) that is disposed or treated
INDICATOR: C3.2 - Percent of public wastewater that is disposed or treated
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of public wastewater collected from outdoor areas, such as streets, parks, and public spaces, that is either disposed of or treated through appropriate methods. It assesses the management of stormwater and wastewater from public areas, contributing to the prevention of waterborne diseases and maintaining public health.

INDICATOR: C3.3 - Percentage of households with access to basic sanitation facilities
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of households that have access to basic sanitation facilities, such as toilets and latrines. It reflects the level of sanitation and hygiene practices in the neighborhood, contributing to public health and well-being.

INDICATOR: D1.1 - Percentage of buildings with regular solid waste collection
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that have access to regular solid waste collection services. It reflects the level of sanitation and waste management practices, contributing to the overall cleanliness and health of the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Access to solid waste and recycling collection points
INDICATOR: D2.1 - Proximity of the resident population to the solid waste and recycling collection point
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average distance between residential and non-residential buildings and the nearest solid waste and recycling collection points. It assesses the accessibility of these points for residents and businesses, contributing to efficient waste management and reducing littering.

CRITERION: Access to solid waste and recycling collection points
INDICATOR: D2.2 - Percentage of inhabitants with access to solid waste and recycling collection points within 400 meters walking distance
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents who have access to solid waste and recycling collection points within a 400-meter walking distance. It assesses the convenience and accessibility of these points for residents, encouraging proper waste disposal and reducing the likelihood of illegal burning.

INDICATOR: E1.1 - Number of days within a year that PM₂.₅ concentration exceeds the daily limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of days in a year when the concentration of fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅) exceeds the established daily limit. It assesses the air quality in terms of exposure to harmful pollutants and their potential impact on human health.

INDICATOR: E1.2 - Number of days within a year that PM10 concentration exceeds the daily limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of days in a year when the concentration of particulate matter (PM₁₀) exceeds the established daily limit. It assesses the long-term air quality in terms of exposure to larger particulates (PM₁₀) and their potential impact on human health.

INDICATOR: E1.3 - Number of days within a year that NO₂ concentration exceeds the daily limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of days in a year when the concentration of nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) exceeds the established daily limit. It assesses the air quality in terms of exposure to NO₂ and its potential impact on human health, particularly respiratory issues.

INDICATOR: E1.4 - Number of days within a year that SO₂ concentration exceeds the daily limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of days in a year when the concentration of sulfur dioxide (SO₂) exceeds the established daily limit. It assesses the air quality in terms of exposure to SO₂ and its potential impact on human health and the environment.

INDICATOR: E1.5 - Number of days within a year that O₃ concentration exceeds the daily limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of days in a year when the concentration of ozone (O₃) exceeds the established daily limit. It assesses the air quality in terms of exposure to O₃ and its potential impact on human health, particularly respiratory issues, and the environment.

INDICATOR: E2.1 - Percentage of building area over noise limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of building area that is exposed to noise levels exceeding established limits during the day. It assesses the acoustic environment in the neighborhood and its potential impact on the quality of life, promoting a healthier and more comfortable living environment.

INDICATOR: E2.2 - Percentage of building area over noise limit
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of building area that is exposed to noise levels exceeding established limits during the night. It assesses the acoustic environment in the neighborhood during nighttime hours and its potential impact on sleep, rest, and overall well-being, promoting a healthier and more peaceful living environment.

CRITERION: Exposure to high frequency electromagnetic fields
INDICATOR: E3.1 - Percentage of mobile network antenna sites in compliance with EMF exposure guidelines
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of mobile network antenna sites that comply with established electromagnetic field (EMF) exposure guidelines. It assesses the potential exposure of residents to EMF radiation and contributes to evaluating the overall electromagnetic environment in the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Percentage of buildings exposed to ELF magnetic field
INDICATOR: E3.2 - Percentage of buildings in the area located not respecting the safety distance from high voltage lines
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that are located within the safety distance from high voltage lines. It assesses the potential exposure of residents to extremely low frequency (ELF) magnetic fields and contributes to evaluating the overall electromagnetic environment in the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Degree of atmospheric light pollution caused by exterior public lighting systems
INDICATOR: E4.1 - Percentage of lighting fixtures with upward luminous emission coefficient equal to 0%
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of exterior public lighting fixtures that have an upward luminous emission coefficient of 0%. It assesses the efficiency of the lighting system in minimizing light pollution by directing most of the light downward, reducing glare and energy consumption.

CRITERION: Performance of the public transport system
INDICATOR: F1.1 - Percentage of inhabitants that are within 400 meters walking distance of at least one public transportation service stop
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents who have access to a public transportation service stop within a 400-meter walking distance. It assesses the accessibility and convenience of the public transportation system for residents, contributing to its overall performance and effectiveness.

CRITERION: Walking distance to public transport for area workers and students
INDICATOR: F1.2 - Percent of workers and students who can reach a public transport stop within a 400 meters distance
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of workers and students who have access to a public transportation service stop within a 400-meter walking distance. It assesses the accessibility and convenience of the public transportation system for those commuting to work or school, contributing to its overall performance and effectiveness.

INDICATOR: F2.1 - Number of shared vehicles per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of shared vehicles, such as car-sharing services, in relation to the population size. It assesses the potential for shared vehicles to provide an alternative mode of transportation, reducing car ownership and promoting sustainable mobility.

INDICATOR: F2.2 - Electric vehicle charging stations per inhabitant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of electric vehicle charging stations in relation to the population size. It assesses the infrastructure support for electric vehicles, encouraging their adoption and use as a more sustainable transportation option.

INDICATOR: F2.3 - Total length of bicycle paths in the neighborhood per inhabitant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of bicycle paths in the neighborhood in relation to the population size. It assesses the infrastructure support for cycling, encouraging its use as an alternative mode of transportation, reducing traffic congestion and greenhouse gas emissions.

INDICATOR: F2.4 - Number of shared bicycles per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of shared bicycles in the neighborhood in relation to the population size. It assesses the potential for shared bicycles to provide an alternative mode of transportation, reducing car ownership and promoting sustainable mobility.

INDICATOR: F2.5 - Bicycle parking spaces per inhabitant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of bicycle parking facilities in the neighborhood in relation to the population size. It assesses the infrastructure support for cycling, encouraging its use as an alternative mode of transportation by providing safe and convenient storage for bicycles.

INDICATOR: F3.1 - Percentage of the neighborhood designated as a pedestrian/car free zone
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the neighborhood that is designated as a pedestrian or car-free zone. It assesses the prioritization of pedestrian safety and comfort, creating more livable and walkable spaces.

INDICATOR: F3.2 - Percentage of roads’ length that has dedicated sidewalks
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of road length that has dedicated sidewalks. It assesses the accessibility of the neighborhood for pedestrians, promoting connectivity and walkability.

INDICATOR: F3.3 - Percentage of bicycle paths physically separated from traffic roads
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of bicycle paths that are physically separated from traffic roads. It assesses the safety of bicycle infrastructure, encouraging cycling as a safer alternative to private car use.

INDICATOR: F3.4 - Traffic fatalities per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of traffic fatalities per 1,000 inhabitants. It assesses road safety and the effectiveness of traffic management measures in preventing accidents and fatalities.

CRITERION: Cyclomatic complexity of the street network
INDICATOR: F4.1 - Cyclomatic number
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the complexity of the street network using the cyclomatic number. It assesses the connectivity and efficiency of the road network, considering factors like intersections and loops. A higher cyclomatic number indicates a more complex and interconnected network, potentially improving accessibility and providing alternative routes.

INDICATOR: F4.2 - Number of intersections related to the overall surface area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the density of intersections within the street network relative to the total area. A higher number of intersections indicates a more interconnected and well-connected street network, potentially improving accessibility and providing alternative routes for travel.

CRITERION: Public buildings that are accessible for use by physically disabled persons
INDICATOR: G1.1 - Percent of key public buildings that are accessible for use by physically disabled persons
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of key public buildings, such as schools, hospitals, and government offices, that are accessible for use by individuals with physical disabilities. It assesses the inclusivity and accessibility of the built environment for all residents.

CRITERION: Sidewalks and other pedestrian paths that are accessible for use by physically disabled persons
INDICATOR: G1.2 - Percent of sidewalks and other pedestrian ways that are accessible for use by physically disabled persons
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of sidewalks and other pedestrian paths in the neighborhood that are accessible for use by individuals with physical disabilities. It assesses the inclusivity and accessibility of public outdoor spaces, allowing residents with disabilities to move freely and participate in community activities.

CRITERION: Barrier-free accessibility in local outdoor public areas
INDICATOR: G1.3 - Adequacy of barrier-free accessible public outdoor areas compared to the total public area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of public outdoor areas, such as parks, squares, and green spaces, that are accessible for individuals with physical disabilities. It assesses the inclusivity and accessibility of public spaces, allowing residents with disabilities to enjoy and benefit from the neighborhood's amenities.

INDICATOR: G2.1 - Housing properties in the local area that are financially accessible to the lowest quintile of area population
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of housing properties in the neighborhood that are financially accessible to the lowest income quintile of the population. It assesses the affordability of housing in the area, considering factors like income levels, housing prices, and rental costs.

INDICATOR: G2.2 - Percentage of the average salary of the lowest quintile of the population used for rental payments
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the average salary of the lowest income quintile of the population that is spent on rental payments. It assesses the affordability of housing rentals for low-income residents, considering the relationship between income levels and rental costs.

CRITERION: Vacant residential units in the neighborhood
INDICATOR: G2.3 - Percentage of vacant residential units
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residential units in the neighborhood that are vacant. It assesses the housing market dynamics, identifying potential areas for development or redevelopment to meet current and future housing needs.

INDICATOR: G2.4 - Percentage of inhabitants living in slums, informal settlements or inadequate housing
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents living in slums, informal settlements, or inadequate housing conditions. It assesses the housing challenges faced by the neighborhood, highlighting the need for improved housing conditions and infrastructure.

CATEGORY: G3. Availability of public and private facilities and services
CRITERION: Availability and proximity of key services
INDICATOR: G3.1 - Percentage of inhabitants that are within 800 meters walking distance of at least 3 key services
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents who have access to at least three key services within an 800-meter walking distance. It assesses the accessibility and convenience of these services for residents, contributing to the overall quality of life and livability of the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Availability and proximity of a public primary school
INDICATOR: G3.2 - Percentage of population near a public primary school
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population that lives within a reasonable walking distance of a public primary school. It assesses the accessibility of primary education for children in the neighborhood, ensuring that they have access to educational opportunities within their local community.

CRITERION: Availability and proximity of a public secondary school
INDICATOR: G3.3 - Percentage of population near a public secondary school
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population that lives within a reasonable walking distance of a public secondary school. It assesses the accessibility of secondary education for young people in the neighborhood, ensuring that they have access to educational opportunities within their local community.

CRITERION: Availability and proximity of childrens’ play facilities
INDICATOR: G3.4 - Percentage of population near a childrens’ play facilities
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population that lives within a reasonable walking distance of children’s play facilities, such as parks, playgrounds, and recreational areas. It assesses the availability of recreational spaces for children in the neighborhood, promoting their physical and social development.

INDICATOR: G3.5 - Average share of the built-up area of the neighborhood that is open space for public use
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the built-up area of the neighborhood that is designated as open space for public use. It assesses the availability of green spaces and recreational areas for residents, promoting a healthy and enjoyable living environment and contributing to the neighborhood's character and cultural identity.

INDICATOR: G4.1 - Net primary enrollment rate
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the percentage of children enrolled in primary education, excluding those who have already completed the primary level. It assesses the access to primary education and reflects the progress towards achieving universal primary education, contributing to reducing educational inequalities.

INDICATOR: G4.2 - Ratio of female to male mean years of education received of population age 25+
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the ratio of the average years of education completed by women to the average years of education completed by men in the population aged 25 and older. It assesses gender equality in education and reflects the progress made in empowering women and promoting gender equality.

INDICATOR: G4.3 - Lower secondary completion rate
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the percentage of students who complete lower secondary education. It assesses the access to and completion of secondary education, reflecting the progress towards achieving universal secondary education and reducing educational inequalities.

INDICATOR: G4.4 - Population age 25-34 with tertiary educational attainment
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the percentage of the population aged 25 to 34 who have completed tertiary education. It assesses the access to and attainment of higher education, reflecting the progress towards achieving universal tertiary education and reducing educational inequalities.

INDICATOR: G5.1 - Percentage of households unable to afford the most basic levels of energy (more than 10% of the income spent on energy bills)
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of households that are unable to afford the most basic levels of energy, defined as spending more than 10% of their income on energy bills. It assesses the risk of energy poverty, highlighting the financial burden of energy costs on households and its potential impact on their overall well-being.

CRITERION: Population at risk of poverty or exclusion
INDICATOR: G5.2 - Share of persons with an equivalised disposable income below 60 % of the national median income
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population with an equivalent disposable income below 60% of the national median income. It assesses the risk of poverty or social exclusion, identifying individuals and households who are struggling to meet basic needs and participate fully in society.

INDICATOR: G6.1 - Number of police officers per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of police officers per 1,000 inhabitants. It assesses the level of police presence and resources available for crime prevention and response in the neighborhood.

INDICATOR: G6.2 - Number of firefighters per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the number of firefighters per 1,000 inhabitants. It assesses the level of fire service presence and resources available for fire prevention and response in the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Population living in disaster prone areas
INDICATOR: G6.3 - Percentage of inhabitants living in a zone subject to natural hazards
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population residing in areas identified as being prone to natural hazards, such as cyclones, drought, floods, earthquakes, volcanoes, and landslides. It assesses the vulnerability of the population to these hazards and the potential for significant risks to life and property.

INDICATOR: G7.1 - Number of in-patient public hospital beds per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the availability of in-patient public hospital beds in relation to the population size. It assesses the capacity of the healthcare system to provide inpatient care and hospitalization services, contributing to the overall health and well-being of the community.

INDICATOR: G8.1 - Area of urban agricultural land on total neighborhood area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the total neighborhood area that is dedicated to urban agricultural land. It assesses the availability of space for urban agriculture and its potential contribution to local food production, promoting sustainable and resilient urban development.

CRITERION: Compatibility of urban design with local cultural values
INDICATOR: G9.1 - Compatibility with local area traditional values of street layouts and the character of urban spaces
DESCRIPTION: This indicator assesses the extent to which the urban design and architecture of buildings in the neighborhood align with local cultural traditions and values, including street layouts and the character of urban spaces. It promotes the preservation of cultural heritage and the creation of places that reflect the unique identity of the community.

CRITERION: Compatibility of public open space with local cultural values
INDICATOR: G9.2 - Compatibility with local area traditional values of local public open spaces, including major uses, dimensions and adjacent uses
DESCRIPTION: This indicator assesses the extent to which public open spaces in the neighborhood align with local cultural traditions and values, considering factors such as major uses, dimensions, and the relationship with adjacent land uses. It promotes the preservation of cultural heritage and the creation of public spaces that reflect the unique identity and needs of the community.

CRITERION: Perceived safety of public areas for pedestrians
INDICATOR: G10.1 - Perceived safety of public places and pedestrian routes, as determined by a sample of pedestrians
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the perceived safety of public places and pedestrian routes, as assessed by a sample of pedestrians. It provides insights into the public's perception of safety and identifies areas where improvements can be made to enhance the overall safety and well-being of pedestrians in the neighborhood.

CRITERION: Impact of commercial signage on the visual environment
INDICATOR: G10.2 - Visual impact of exterior commercial signage
DESCRIPTION: This indicator assesses the visual impact of exterior commercial signage on the neighborhood's aesthetic appeal and overall visual environment. It considers factors such as the size, design, and placement of signage, and evaluates their contribution to visual clutter or enhancement of the neighborhood's character.

CRITERION: Impact of overhead electric distribution system
INDICATOR: G10.3 - Visual impact of above-grade electrical distribution systems
DESCRIPTION: This indicator assesses the visual impact of overhead electric distribution systems on the neighborhood's aesthetic appeal. It considers factors such as the size, design, and placement of power lines and equipment, and evaluates their contribution to visual clutter or the overall visual environment.

CRITERION: Average annual per-capita income of residents
INDICATOR: H1.1 - Percentage of average per-capita income
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average annual per-capita income of residents in the neighborhood. It provides an overall assessment of the economic well-being of the population, considering factors like wages, salaries, and other income sources.

INDICATOR: H2.1 - Percentage of working age adults unemployed or actively looking for work
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of working-age adults who are unemployed or actively seeking employment. It reflects the health of the labor market, the economic development of the neighborhood, and the overall quality of life for residents, as unemployment can negatively impact individuals and families.

INDICATOR: H2.2 - Percentage of unemployed youth
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of young people who are unemployed or actively seeking employment. It specifically focuses on the challenges faced by young people in the labor market, identifying trends and potential barriers to their employment opportunities.

INDICATOR: H3.1 - Proportion of business registrations per 10,000 inhabitants aged 16 and above
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the rate of new business registrations in the neighborhood relative to the population size. It reflects the level of entrepreneurial activity, economic dynamism, and job creation potential in the neighborhood.

INDICATOR: H4.1 - Percentage of households with fixed (wired) broadband
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of households that have access to fixed (wired) broadband internet connections. It reflects the level of connectivity and access to information and communication technologies (ICT) in the neighborhood, which is essential for participation in the digital economy and society.

INDICATOR: H4.2 - Percentage of the neighborhood area served by wireless broadband (3G, 4G, 5G)
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the neighborhood area that is covered by wireless broadband networks (3G, 4G, 5G). It reflects the level of mobile internet connectivity and access to information and communication technologies (ICT), which is essential for participation in the digital economy and society.

CRITERION: Availability of WIFI in Public Areas
INDICATOR: H4.3 - Number of public WIFI hotspots in the neighborhood per 1,000 inhabitants
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the density of public WIFI hotspots in the neighborhood relative to the population size. It reflects the availability of free or low-cost internet access in public spaces, promoting digital inclusion and providing opportunities for residents to connect online.

INDICATOR: H4.4 - Total number of mobile phone subscriptions in the area divided by one 1000th of the area’s total population
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the density of mobile phone subscriptions in the area, reflecting the level of mobile phone penetration and access to communication technologies. It provides insights into the adoption of mobile devices and their role in facilitating communication, information access, and innovation within the neighborhood.

CATEGORY: I. Climate Change: mitigation and adaptation

INDICATOR: I1.1 - Total amount of greenhouse gases (equivalent carbon dioxide units) generated from building operations over a calendar year per inhabitant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total amount of greenhouse gases emitted from building operations per inhabitant, expressed in equivalent carbon dioxide units. It assesses the neighborhood's contribution to climate change and identifies opportunities for reducing greenhouse gas emissions through energy-efficient practices and sustainable building design.

CRITERION: Greenhouse gas emissions from residential buildings
INDICATOR: I1.2 - Total amount of greenhouse gases in Kg (equivalent carbon dioxide units) generated over a calendar year per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total amount of greenhouse gases emitted from residential buildings per square meter of indoor useful floor area. It assesses the energy efficiency and environmental impact of residential buildings, contributing to the overall understanding of urban greenhouse gas emissions.

CRITERION: Embodied carbon for construction and renovation of infrastructures
INDICATOR: I1.3 - Aggregated total embodied carbon per aggregated linear area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total embodied carbon per unit of linear area for construction and renovation of infrastructures. It assesses the environmental impact of construction materials and encourages the use of materials with lower embodied carbon, contributing to a more sustainable built environment.

CRITERION: Embodied carbon for construction/ renovation of residential buildings
INDICATOR: I1.4 - Aggregated total embodied carbon per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total embodied carbon per square meter of indoor useful floor area for construction and renovation of residential buildings. It assesses the environmental impact of construction materials used in residential buildings and encourages the use of materials with lower embodied carbon, contributing to a more sustainable built environment.

CRITERION: Embodied carbon for construction/ renovation of public offices/educational buildings
INDICATOR: I1.5 - Aggregated total embodied carbon per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total embodied carbon per square meter of indoor useful floor area for construction and renovation of public offices and educational buildings. It assesses the environmental impact of construction materials used in these buildings and encourages the use of materials with lower embodied carbon, contributing to a more sustainable built environment.

INDICATOR: I1.6 - Potential CO₂ sequestration in the neighborhood per hectare
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the potential for carbon dioxide (CO₂) sequestration within the neighborhood per hectare of land area. It assesses the natural carbon sinks available in the neighborhood, such as forests, green spaces, and soils, and their potential to absorb and store CO₂, contributing to climate change mitigation efforts.

CATEGORY: I2. Adaptation to the climatic action: heatwaves and increase of temperature
INDICATOR: I2.1 - Mean Solar Reflectance Index of paved surfaces and roofs in the neighborhood
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average solar reflectance index (SRI) of paved surfaces and roofs in the neighborhood. It assesses the reflectivity of these surfaces, which influences their ability to absorb or reflect solar radiation. Higher SRI values indicate more reflective surfaces, which can help mitigate the urban heat island effect by reducing heat absorption and increasing cooling potential.

CRITERION: Use of vegetation to provide ambient outdoor cooling
INDICATOR: I2.2 - Leaf Area Index: ratio of total vegetated surface area (on ground and on roofs, and including trees), divided by total site area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the Leaf Area Index (LAI) of the neighborhood, which represents the total leaf area per unit of ground area. It assesses the role of vegetation in providing ambient cooling through evapotranspiration, which involves the release of water vapor into the atmosphere, leading to a cooling effect. Higher LAI values indicate greater vegetation coverage and potential for cooling.

INDICATOR: I2.3 - Aggregate area of building roofs covered with vegetated material
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total area of building roofs covered with vegetation, expressed as a percentage of the total roof area in the neighborhood. It assesses the prevalence of green roofs and their potential contribution to mitigating the urban heat island effect, improving air quality, and providing habitat for biodiversity.

CATEGORY: I3. Adaptation to the climatic action: pluvial flood
CRITERION: Stormwater retention capacity on site by buildings
INDICATOR: I3.1 - Share of the attenuation storage capacity by buildings in relation to the optimal volume
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the optimal stormwater retention capacity that is achieved through on-site storage in buildings. It assesses the effectiveness of stormwater management practices implemented in buildings, such as rain gardens, green roofs, and cisterns, in reducing stormwater runoff and mitigating flooding risks.

INDICATOR: I3.2 - Share of the optimal capacity of sustainable urban drainage systems
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the optimal sustainable urban drainage system (SUDS) capacity that is implemented in the neighborhood. It assesses the effectiveness of SUDS in managing stormwater runoff, reducing flooding risks, and improving water quality, promoting a more sustainable and resilient urban environment.

INDICATOR: I3.3 - Percentage of weighted ground permeability
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the average ground permeability of the neighborhood, considering the different types of soil and land cover. It assesses the soil's ability to absorb and infiltrate water, which is crucial for managing stormwater runoff, reducing flooding risks, and improving groundwater recharge. Higher permeability values indicate more permeable soils that can effectively absorb water.

CATEGORY: I4. Adaptation to the climatic action: fluvial and coastal flood
INDICATOR: I4.1 - Percentage of population exposed to flood risk
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population living in areas exposed to flood risk. It assesses the vulnerability of residents to flooding and the potential for property damage and displacement.

INDICATOR: I4.2 - Share of land in vulnerable areas protected by flooding barriers
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of land in vulnerable areas that is protected by flooding barriers. It assesses the effectiveness of flood protection measures in reducing the risk of flooding and protecting vulnerable areas from damage.

INDICATOR: I4.3 - Share of buildings with elevated ground floor in vulnerable sites
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings located in vulnerable areas that have an elevated ground floor. It assesses the level of protection of buildings from flooding and their resilience to flood events.

CATEGORY: I5. Adaptation to the climatic action: drought
CRITERION: Rainwater collection and storage from buildings for non-potable uses
INDICATOR: I5.1 - Share of buildings in the neighborhood with a rainwater collection system
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that have implemented rainwater collection systems for non-potable uses, such as irrigation, flushing toilets, or washing. It assesses the prevalence of rainwater harvesting practices and their potential contribution to reducing potable water consumption and managing stormwater runoff.

CRITERION: Rainwater collection and storage from outdoor areas
INDICATOR: I5.2 - Share of rainwater collected from paved (not permeable) surfaces in the neighborhood (excluding buildings’ roofs and plots)
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of rainwater collected from paved surfaces in the neighborhood, excluding buildings’ roofs and plots. It assesses the implementation of rainwater harvesting practices in public areas and their potential contribution to reducing stormwater runoff and increasing water availability for non-potable uses.

CRITERION: Greywater collection in buildings for non-potable uses
INDICATOR: I5.3 - Share of buildings in the neighborhood with a greywater collection system
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of buildings in the neighborhood that have implemented greywater collection systems. It assesses the prevalence of greywater harvesting practices and their potential contribution to reducing potable water consumption by reusing wastewater for non-potable purposes, such as irrigation and flushing toilets.

INDICATOR: I5.4 - Share of landscape (green areas) plated with local vegetation
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of green areas in the neighborhood that are planted with local vegetation species. It assesses the use of native plants, which are adapted to the local climate and soil conditions, promoting biodiversity, reducing maintenance requirements, and contributing to the neighborhood's ecological sustainability.

CATEGORY: I6. Adaptation to the climatic action: pluvial flood
INDICATOR: I6.1 - Percentage of population exposed to wildfire risk
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the population living in areas exposed to wildfire risk. It assesses the vulnerability of residents to wildfires and the potential for property damage and displacement.

INDICATOR: I6.2 - Share of wildfire vulnerable areas protected by fire barriers
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of wildfire-vulnerable areas that are protected by fire barriers. It assesses the effectiveness of fire prevention measures in reducing the risk of wildfires and protecting vulnerable areas from damage.

INDICATOR: I6.3 - Share of ground cover materials (excluding buildings’ plots) in vulnerable areas that are fire resistant
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of ground cover materials in vulnerable areas, excluding buildings’ plots, that are fire resistant. It assesses the level of fire protection in the neighborhood and the resilience of the landscape to wildfires.

INDICATOR: I7.1 - Strategies to minimise the impact of wind
DESCRIPTION: This indicator assesses the effectiveness of urban design strategies in mitigating the impact of wind. It considers factors such as building orientation, street layouts, and the use of windbreaks or barriers to reduce wind speed and create more comfortable outdoor spaces.

CRITERION: Community involvement in urban planning activities
INDICATOR: J1.1 - Percentage of residents active in public urban planning
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents who are actively involved in public urban planning processes. It assesses the level of community engagement and participation in decision-making regarding the development and future of the neighborhood, promoting a more democratic and inclusive approach to urban planning.

CRITERION: Involvement of residents in community affairs
INDICATOR: J2.1 - Percentage of resident population above 16 years having an involvement in community affairs
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of residents aged 16 and older who are actively involved in community affairs. It assesses the level of civic engagement and participation in community activities, fostering a sense of belonging and promoting community development.

INDICATOR: J3.1 - Percentage area of the public buildings with recognized sustainability certifications on ongoing operations.
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the proportion of the total floor area of public buildings that have achieved a recognized sustainability certification. It reflects the level of commitment to sustainable practices and energy efficiency in public buildings, contributing to a more sustainable and environmentally friendly neighborhood.

CRITERION: Operating energy costs for public buildings
INDICATOR: J3.2 - Aggregated annual operating energy cost per aggregated indoor useful floor area
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the annual operating energy costs per square meter of indoor useful floor area for public buildings. It assesses the energy consumption and associated costs of operating public buildings, providing insights for improving energy efficiency and reducing operational expenses.

INDICATOR: J3.3 - Total end use of energy in public buildings within a neighborhood divided by total indoor useful area of these buildings
DESCRIPTION: This indicator measures the total end-use energy consumption in public buildings per square meter of indoor useful floor area. It assesses the energy efficiency of public buildings, identifying areas for improvement in reducing energy consumption and promoting sustainable practices.
